intro: Psiguria ottoniana, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water, typical of xerophytic species. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Psiguria ottoniana is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a hardy plant for desert environments.
